metadata.Title: CVE-2017-12192 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
The keyctl_read_key function in security/keys/keyctl.c in the KeyManagement subcomponent in the Linux kernel before 4.13.5 does not properlyconsider that a key may be possessed but negatively instantiated, whichallows local users to cause a denial of service (OOPS and system crash) viaa crafted KEYCTL_READ operation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-12192` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-98.121
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-98.121
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1076-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1076.84
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1078-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1078.83
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1039.48
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-generic - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-143-lowlatency - 4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1033-gke - 4.4.0-1033.33
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1033-gke - 4.4.0-1033.33
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1114-azure - 4.13.0-1005.7
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1099-gcp - 4.13.0-1002.5
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1009.14
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.13.0-1008-oem - 4.13.0-1008.9
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-98.121').
linux-mako: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1076.84').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1078.83').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1039.48').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-26.29~16.04.2').
linux-gke package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1033.33').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1005.7').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1002.5').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1009.14').
linux-euclid: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needed').
linux-oem package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.13.0-1008.9').
